Reviews.Title: “Cheap and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Katarina Z
Reviews.Content: Most reviews were pretty old, so I didn't quite know what to expect when I chose this hotel only for the price, but I was pleasantly surprised. My single room was small but clean and nice. The staff was very nice and helpful. Beware the reception is not open at night, though it's not a problem as long as you contact them about late arrival. It might not be extremely central but communications were good and there was a lot of reasonably priced restaurants close.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very helpful staff, but wherei s my reservation?”
Reviews.Author: Penguin66
Reviews.Content: On arrival, they could find find no trace of my reservation, which could be their mistake or an error by Booking.com. With it being a weekend they could only only accomodate me for 1 of my 2 nights, but very quickly made arrangements for me elsewhere . I had not been in the room more than 5 minutes when reception called to say they had made arrangemed my second nights accomodation at Hotel 26 ( just accross the rodad-very nice & also reviewed ). It was more expensive, but Junckers would pay the difference. Excellent service! Junckers is in a good location it a funky part of town with lots of good bars and places to eat. You are never far from the bus/train/tram in Berlin but buses stop right outside, trams stop at the end of the road and the U-Bahn is only a few minutes walk. The hotel itself is OK for the price, but you don't get breakfast included. My room ( a single ) was on the small side, but had everything I was going to need. Bathroom, also on the small side, but everything worked and was very clean. Recepetion was quite modern and the breakfast/bar area behind was well kept, but other areas of the hotel looked a bit more old fashioned, but everywhere was clean and well kept. The real highlight here though are the staff who were always helpful. All in all, I would stay at Junckers again if travelling alone. I would just double check direct with them they had my booking confirmed. If travelling with freinds/family/partner and wanted a bit more comfort, I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but OK”
Reviews.Author: Vannegen
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for. For some 25 euro per person in a single room, you should not expect luxury. Indeed, the part of the entire establishment I got accomodated in, was located in the backyard and called "pension", not the "hotel", which seemed more upgraded and cultivated. The room I was given was very small and basic (just a sink) with shared WC&bath facilities. It was something of a one star spot standard. Adequate for 25 euro, but obviously disappointing, if you would still have hoped to stay in a real hotel for that price. The good thing about the hotel was an unlimited coffee and tee usage at the reception during the day (at least, that is was I was told). Another positive issue is its proximity to the Ostbahnhof train station, as well as to the U-Bahn line: 2 and 1 tram stops, respectively. All in all, rather recommandable but for short stays, only when you don't need much more than just a bed to lay down at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and affordable”
Reviews.Author: muchomas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights with my girlfriend. The place itself is pretty quaint, and just a couple minutes walk from some useful train stations. The room was pretty basic and clean. What impressed us most was the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff. For example, we found the room a little hot for our first night (there was some sort of heat wave in Berlin) and without much trouble we were able to get a nice fan for the second night. If you're looking in this price range, definitely keep this place in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Fix the bed's and I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Sualk99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Junckers for four nights in july. It has a good location, clean rooms, friendly staff and a reasonable price. We didn't bother the breakfast - it costs 8 Euro extra. During the night there were some noice from the backyard and the surroundings. The bigges problem was the beds - they were just to hard and uncomfortable. If they just could fix the beds, I would choose Junckers again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff excellent”
Reviews.Author: Burmis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 6 nights. The room was comfortable, although the bathroom was across the hall, it was large and I had been advised of this before booking in. It is in the middle of Friedrichshain, close to the underground, trams and s-bahn. I found the staff hugely helpful and when I requested to leave one day earlier, they were extremely cooperative. This hotel has a really comfortable and safe "family owned" feel, which was very important for a solo female traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Three stars and a lot of hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Austriacus
Reviews.Content: During a two-nights stay at Juncker's Hotel Garni I got the impression that this is a pretty normal three-stars hotel. The double room where I stayed as a solo traveller was rather small and even more so was the bath room. The rather unattractive furniture fulfilled its purpose and was in good condition. Couples may be dissatisfied by the two single beds instead of a double bed, whereas for me this was, of course, irrelevant. Although I like firm beds, even by my standards the bed in my room was much too rigid. What I appreciated, on the other hand, was the desk equipped with a decent lamp, which rendered working in the evening quite comfortable. There were a few minor shortcomings. First, when stretching out the legs under the desk the feet got entangled in the maze of cables lying on the floor. Second, there was nothing where I could put the soap and the shampoo in the shower. Since my room (as most others of this hotel) was directed to the inner court, it was perfectly silent at night. In the morning I could even hear the birds twitter. This quietness may rather have had to do with the fact that the adjacent rooms were either empty or that the guests staying there produced virtually no noise than with the sound insulation of the building, because in the evening I could once hear a guest in a neighbouring room snoring. In contrast to most hotels nowadays there is self-service only for coffee, tea and cereals, but no buffet breakfast. Instead, a plate with meat, cheese and some vegetables is served along with butter, jam, honey, different kinds of bread and a glass of orange juice. In addition, the staff offers freshly boiled eggs as well as yoghurt, and tries to fulfil any special withes. This is the characteristic of Juncker's Hotel Garni: Its owners and the staff are always helpful and friendly and try to make the stay as convenient as possible. This creates the hospitable atmosphere that is the hallmark of this hotel. As a drawback to be mentioned it is a bit pricey compared to other hotels of a similar standard. It is situated in an area that is neither pretty not ugly but in between. According to some locals, safety would sometimes be an issue there. However, I did not experience any problem of that kind. A favourable feature of the area is the wide variety of bars and restaurants in particular in Simon-Dach-Strasse. Furthermore, this hotel is well suited for users of public transport due to the large number of connections available at the near U-Bahn and S-Bahn station Warschauer Strasse.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location and best value. Super service”
Reviews.Author: SouthATravel
Reviews.Content: Lots of space in room and great bathrooms. Staff was helpfull and friendly. Coffee and tea through the day. Great location in Fredrichshain. This is a MUST to experience the former East Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great staying”
Reviews.Author: Mimi1981Hedehusene
Reviews.Content: I was staying at Hotel Juncker's with all of my colleagues and we had a great staying. The staff was really nice to us, and helped us whenever we needed it. Good location near to a U-bahn station with connections to the big shopping- and culture places! I would recomment it to others! Its not luxury at all, but nice if you not are picky :D

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcravens
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business, and liked the hotel very much. My room was clean (I'm majorly into clean) and cozy, the nights were quiet and the bed was comfy (I'm also majorly into being able to sleep), and I felt quite safe (I'm also really into feeling safe in a hotel). The hotel has very good wireless connection. I'm not a German speaker, but that wasn't a problem at all at this hotel. I have really bad knees, so I was very happy and surprised that there was an elevator. I was fine with the tiny bathroom and not having a bathtub (just a shower). There's a lot of bars and restaurants all around. The breakfast at the hotel was good (not sure if they could accommodate vegetarians or non-pork eaters, as is the case with most hotels in Germany). I really liked how the hotel was decorated -- the walls weren't bare, but they weren't covered in dreadful "hotel art" either. I think this is a good hotel for short stays (less than a week), for tourists and for business folks. I'm not sure it would be a good hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “A true hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Nigec
Reviews.Content: I agree totally with other reviewers. Any idiot can book a megacorp hotel & could be anywhere from Tokyo to Timbuktu as a result - I always believe its better to seek out independent hotels as you get better service (don't confuse service with being able to order an expensive sandwich at midnight!) & a more local input. The hotel is basic but clean & well equipped. Their service is excellent, all the people I spoke to had good English, which is nice as my German is basic. I stayed for 4 nights while motorcycle touring, the hotel secured the bike in their yard for me. It's in the old east Berlin, about 20 minutes by walking/ metro from central bits or 20 minutes by bus to Ostbahnhof & the S Bahn, the bus literally stops outside hotel. The hotel will sell you an all day travel ticket for €6.10. If you want a 15 minute walk you can also pick up the S Bahn at the other end of the adjacent main road, which is at the end of the East Side Gallery, the longest remaining section of the wall. Plenty of places to eat out locally as well, which helps if you don't want to travel into Alexanderplatz. Thoroughly recommended, I would stay again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!!”
Reviews.Author: RamiHelsinki
Reviews.Content: We had a late arrival to the hotel but it didn´t cause any problems. The friendliness of the staff made us feel warmly welcome from the beginning. The service was excellent, breakfast tasty and little things such as free coffee and tea made our stay very pleasent. The room was quite moderately furnished but cozy, clean and spaceous enough. The location was excellent. If you´re looking for restaurants with decent prices, trendy boutiques, nice bars or 24h quick eats, this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FISKESUPPE
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel on May 2007 and we are happy to have choosen it. It is not definitely a luxury hotel, neither a "design" hotel, but the room was big, exceptionally clean and very quiet. The bathroom was big enough and also very clean. The hotel has no elevator, I had no problem taking the luggage to the third floor but maybe you must take it into account. There was no air conditioned in the room, nothing important in May, but maybe to consider if you go in summer. Staff is very friendly. The owner, Mr. Juncker, will be happy to help any guest in the morning telling the best way to go to anywhere. The breakfast was good and enough to walk around Berlin until lunch time. The hotel is not in the city centre, but is very well communicated by public tranport. There is the Frankfurter Tor station (U-Bahn nº 5) at a 5 minutes walk, ideal to go to the city centre. There is also a tram line just beside the hotel, the M10, to go to the Warschauer Strasse S-bahn station, with 4 different U and S bahns. If you arrive to Tegel airport, you can take bus TXL to Alexander Platz and then U5 to Frankfurter Tor. If you arrive to Schonefeld, take S9 to Warschauer Strasse and the the tram M10 and step down at Bernauer Strasse. There is also a bus line that stops just in front the hotel but we didn't use it. I recommend to take every morning a daily pass for the public transport (6.1 euros) that allows you to visit Berlin without caring about costs. You can take it at the front desk. So, if you are looking for a budget hotel, very friendly, very clean and well communicated by public transport, Juncker's Hotel Garni is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The neighbourhood did not look too promising on the bus from the Ostbahnhof. Definite reminders of less prosperous times when this was East Berlin. But the bus stops right in front of the hotel - easy for luggage. The family who own this hotel also run it with pride. Not luxurious by any stretch, but extremely clean and in good repair, it makes for a very pleasant base from which to explore the large and rapidly changing city of Berlin. Everyone behind the desk was eager to help us even to doing an internet search and printing the results for us. The foyer is small with a comfortable sitting area. There is tea and coffee available to guests 24/7. The breakfast rooms are cozy and attractive. The waitress searving breakfast was efficient and friendly. Beverages and muesli were self-seve; delicious bread and rolls with cheese and meats, a soft boiled egg if you wanted, were served to your table. Much nicer than many more luxurious places we've stayed at and all inclusive. We saw two rooms. They all have single beds. In some, like the first one the beds are fixed so if if you want a double with the beds together, specifically ask at the time of reservation. Despite the presence of a hostel and several clubs adjacent to our hotel it was very quiet at night. (There are a lot of drinking establishments in Berlin but only a few are really busy at any given time, it seems). There was lots of hot water and an excellent shower. If the owners upgrade only the ubiquitous indoor/outdoor carpet in this hotel they could probably charge 50% more. Berlin is fascinating. Many of the neighbourhoods which were in the east zone are reinventing themselves and undergoing rapid renovation. The neighbourhood around this hotel had some seedy looking spots with some unsavoury looking characters but there were mostly normal working people and recent immigrants. Check out the weekly outdoor markets - great food and good to meet people. Everyone seems to speak English! Berlin is fun, Berliners are tolerant and friendly; a bit different than the rest of Germany.

Reviews.Title: “Junckers Hotel Garni a secret to be shared!”
Reviews.Author: DndG
Reviews.Content: Heard of Juncker's hotel by word of mouth, and having checked the reviews on trip advisor I booked immediately. I agree with all the other reviewers, it is an exceptional little hotel with a great location, and at a very reasonable price (65€ for a single room per night). All the staff are very friendly and helpful but the manager makes the hotel, he has tickets for the public transport system, no end of advice on how to get where you want to go, organises the place like an orchestra conductor and he even advises on the weather. Add to this the really generous breakfasts and overall you will do hard to beat this great little Berlin hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, good value”
Reviews.Author: sgbpillar
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend here, in a single room. The charge for three nights' B and B was €154. My room was pleasant, though it had a blind and no curtains, and was too bright in the mornings (I don't know if this is the case for all rooms). The hotel is very quiet, in Friedrichshain, part of the former East Berlin, where traffic is light. It has good transport links - close to tram, S- and U-Bahn, long-distance rail and bus. The service is impeccable, the place shines and the breakfast is wonderful. The proprietor speaks good English and is extremely knowledgeable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Super Prices”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not only well located and greatly priced. I've stayed in a triple room and it was not only spacious, as it was also very clean and smartly furnished. The owner does speak EXCELLENT english, and is extremely helpful in providing maps and tips for moving around Berlin. The hotel is situated in Grünberger Straße (in Friedrichshain district), just 50m away from the S-Bahn (Street Tram) in Warschauer Straße, which connects you to the whole city transport network. It is a student area, filled with bakeries and cafes, and also some nice bars (check the Grünberger Straße bit AFTER the Warschauer Straße crossing). If you catch the S-Bahn in the 'Warschauer Straße Bahnhof (Station)' direction, you'll be 200m away from the artistic 'Berlin Wall' section in Mühlenstraße. If you catch it in the other way, get out in the next stop and you have the Frankfurter Tor subway station and the splendorous Karl-Marx-Allee - 6 stops to Alexanderplatz. I also recommend the café Deniz Imbiss in Warschauer Straße - great food at ridiculous low prices!

Reviews.Title: “An Absolute Gem”
Reviews.Author: JerryinChicago
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Juncker's Hotel twice now--in March 2004 and December 2004--and am writing this review even though it will let out the secret of this outstanding hotel. The proprietor is jovial and welcoming (I've spoken with him only in German, but I assume he also speaks English), and the ensuite rooms, though on the small side, are bright, smartly furnished, comfortable, and immaculate. At an even lower cost are four "pension" rooms--two singles, a double, and a triple--that are just about as nice and share a pair of spotless showers and toilets. (In 2004 the single pension room, which I found very pleasant last March, is going for just 24 Euros!) The hotel's breaksfast room is cheery, but I haven't taken breakfast there because the neighborhood is full of bakeries that serve juice, coffee, and an array of German rolls and pastries. Finally, the location is outstanding: just a block from the Frankfurter Tor U-Bahn stop, which is just six quick stops from Alexanderplatz. You can get from Tegel Airport to the hotel--by the 128 bus to the Osloer Strasse U-Bahn stop, from there to Alexanderplatz, and then to the hotel--in under an hour. You simply won't find a nicer small hotel in Berlin at this price!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel advertised on the web and it sounded ok. It's just off the direct S-bahn route into the city centre from Schoenfeld airport, and is about 5 minutes walk from Warschaur St. station, but a tram or bus will take you almost to the door. Although an oldish building the interior is in excellent condition. The rooms are very well equiped and imaculate. The breakfasts are first class and the service is great. The staff were very helpful and provided maps and good advice on getting around the city. They also sold tickets that covered all the city transport system. After the first day I began to think I had got the room rates wrong as they seemed too low for what was provided, but the charges were as advertised when I got the bill. A gem of a hotel.

HotelInfo.Name: Juncker's Hotel Garni
HotelInfo.Address: Grunberger Strasse 21, 10243 Berlin, Germany
